title: Central NJ: Hands Off Our Planet! Town Hall
description: We are hosting a town hall in Highland Park to address climate challenges and potential solutions, including the NJ Climate Superfund Act. Join us to engage with state and municipal leaders, hear stories from impacted community members, and learn how you can take action for critical policy solutions in New Jersey.
raw_text:
Central NJ: Hands Off Our Planet! Town Hall
Town Hall * Hosted by Food & Water Watch

Earth Day Town Hall Series
HANDS OFF OUR PLANET!
Confronting the Climate and Affordability Crises in NJ
Make Polluters Pay!

May 15 THURSDAY
MIDDLESEX COUNTY
Reformed Church of Highland Park
7:00 - 8:30 PM

Time
Thursday, May 15
7 – 8:30pm EDT

Location
Reformed Church of Highland Park
19 S 2nd Ave
Highland Park, NJ 08904
Map

About this event
Central Jersey Empower NJ Town Hall: Confronting the Climate and Affordability Crises

With unprecedented federal attacks on climate science, the gutting of federal protections for clean air and water, and the attempt to eliminate funding for emergency response to climate disasters, we need our elected officials in New Jersey to fill the leadership void. These attacks are happening as working families across our state are already struggling to keep up with the rising costs of healthcare, insurance, housing, and utilities, and as the damages from extreme storms, flooding, heatwaves, and wildfires continue increasing.

Join us in Highland Park for a town hall on these challenges and potential solutions — like the NJ Climate Superfund Act, which would ensure that the world's wealthiest fossil fuel corporations, not taxpayers, foot the bill for climate disasters.

We’ll be joined by members of our state legislature who are co-sponsoring the NJ Climate Superfund Act as well as municipal leaders who have taken local action in support of this bill. We’ll also hear from community members who have been impacted by the climate crisis, local climate and environmental leaders, and more.

Join us to learn about these issues and how you can take action to support critical policy solutions that invest in our health, environment, and economy here in New Jersey!
raw_summary: The flyer promotes a town hall event in Central New Jersey, focusing on climate and affordability crises, hosted by Food & Water Watch, to discuss policy solutions and actions against environmental issues.

WE ARE THE BRIDGE: RISE FOR RACIAL JUSTICE RALLY

SATURDAY, MAY 24, 2025 | Noon @ Revolution Hall

Remembering George Floyd and 100 Days of Action

Brown Hope is hosting We Are The Bridge at Revolution Hall (1300 SE Stark St) on May 24th, a peaceful march through downtown Portland culminating in a return to Burnside Bridge, the location of the iconic 2020 protest photo which inspired the entire world. title: Celebration of Science, Learning, and Libraries
description: Join us to advocate against the elimination of critical funding to libraries, cuts to science grants, and attacks on education. Gather at Sylvester Park and march to the Capitol Building for speeches.
address: Legislative Building - North Steps, Sylvester Park
raw_text:
Flame the Enlightenment

CELEBRATION OF SCIENCE, LEARNING, AND LIBRARIES

Legislative Building - North Steps, Sylvester Park, Olympia, WA

July 12, 2025

11AM-3PM

Carl Sagan, the science popularizer wrote in the book, "Demon-Haunted World: Science as a Candle in the Dark," that attacks on science, education and libraries brought about the Dark Ages. Meet at Sylvester Park, then march to the North Steps of the Capital Building for speakers. Protest the elimination of critical funding to the Institute of Library Sciences (IMLS), cuts to critical science grants, and the attacks on higher education, and public instruction. Please contact Wendy at 360-349-2158 or wendy.tassoni@gmail.com.
